title.narrative: SAFE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: More girls and boys in targeted areas benefit from a safe and enabling learning environment that ensures their resilience to disasters, mitigating adverse impact of climate change, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Skills Development, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children have improved access to quality inclusive education, from early learning to secondary education, particularly those who are most marginalised

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More girls and boys in targeted areas benefit from a safe and enabling learning environment that ensures their resilience to disasters, mitigating adverse impact of climate change

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF maintained robust Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) programme to build the capacity of government agencies, nongovernmental organizations and educational facilities to better prepare for and respond to the range of natural disasters that frequently affect the country. UNICEF also continued to work closely with the Government of Tajikistan and REACT national and international partners to reach the most vulnerable children and their families and protect their rights during humanitarian situations. At the policy level, UNICEF supported the development of the Mid-term Programme on Population and Territories Protection in Emergency Situations for 2019-2022. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019
